metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Canvas Gradients
HTML Canvas Gradients
Gradients let you display smooth transitions between two or more specified colors.
content.html: Gradients let you display smooth transitions between two or more specified colors.

content.text: Gradients can be used to fill rectangles, circles, lines, text, etc.
content.html: Gradients can be used to fill rectangles, circles, lines, text, etc.

content.text: There are two methods used for creating gradients:
content.html: There are two methods used for creating gradients:

content.text: The createLinearGradient() Method
The createLinearGradient() method is used to define a linear gradient.
content.html: The createLinearGradient() method is used to define a linear gradient.

content.text: A linear gradient changes color along a linear pattern (horizontally/vertically/diagonally).
content.html: A linear gradient changes color along a linear pattern (horizontally/vertically/diagonally).

content.text: The createLinearGradient() method has the following parameters:

content.code_html:
Parameter Description
x0 Required. The x-coordinate of the start point
y0 Required. The y-coordinate of the start point
x1 Required. The x-coordinate of the end point
y1 Required. The y-coordinate of the end point

content.text: The gradient object requires two or more color stops.
content.html: The gradient object requires two or more color stops.

content.text: The addColorStop() method specifies the color stops, and its position along the gradient. The positions can be anywhere between 0 and 1.
content.html: The addColorStop() method specifies the color stops, and its position along the gradient. The positions can be anywhere between 0 and 1.

content.text: To use the gradient, assign it to the fillStyle or strokeStyle property, then draw the shape (rectangle, circle, shape, or text).
content.html: To use the gradient, assign it to the fillStyle or strokeStyle property, then draw the shape (rectangle, circle, shape, or text).

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,
280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill rectangle with gradient
ctx.fillStyle = grad;ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0, 280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill rectangle with gradient
 ctx.fillStyle = grad;
ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);
</script>

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,
280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill outlined rectangle with gradient
ctx.lineWidth = 10;ctx.strokeStyle = grad;ctx.strokeRect(10,10,280,130);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0, 280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill outlined rectangle with gradient
 ctx.lineWidth = 10;
ctx.strokeStyle = grad;
ctx.strokeRect(10,10,280,130);
</script>

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,
280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(0.5, "purple");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill rectangle with gradient
ctx.fillStyle = grad;ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0, 280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(0.5, "purple");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill rectangle with gradient
 ctx.fillStyle = grad;
ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);
</script>

content.text: Vertical Linear Gradient
A horizontal gradient goes from left to right and is created by varying the parameters on the x-axis (x1 and x2). The examples above are all horizontal linear gradients.
content.html: A horizontal gradient goes from left to right and is created by varying the parameters on the x-axis (x1 and x2). The examples above are all horizontal linear gradients.

content.text: A vertical gradient goes from top to bottom and is created by varying the parameters on the y-axis (y1 and y2).
content.html: A vertical gradient goes from top to bottom and is created by varying the parameters on the y-axis (y1 and y2).

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,
0,130);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill rectangle with gradient
ctx.fillStyle = grad;ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0, 0,130);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill rectangle with gradient
 ctx.fillStyle = grad;
ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);
</script>

content.text: Diagonal Linear Gradient
A diagonal gradient is created by varying both the x- and y-axis parameters.
content.html: A diagonal gradient is created by varying both the x- and y-axis parameters.

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,
280,130);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill rectangle with gradient
ctx.fillStyle = grad;ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0, 280,130);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill rectangle with gradient
 ctx.fillStyle = grad;
ctx.fillRect(10,10, 280,130);
</script>

content.text: Fill Circle with Gradient

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill circle with gradientctx.beginPath();ctx.arc(145, 75, 65,
0, 2 * Math.PI);ctx.fillStyle = grad;ctx.fill();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill circle with gradient
ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(145, 75, 65, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
ctx.fillStyle = grad;
ctx.fill();
</script>

content.text: Fill Text with Gradient

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill text with gradientctx.font = "50px Arial";ctx.fillStyle =
grad;ctx.fillText("Hello World",10,80);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill text with gradient
ctx.font = "50px Arial";
ctx.fillStyle = grad;
ctx.fillText("Hello World",10,80);
</script>

content.text: Fill Outlined Text with Gradient

content.code:
<script>const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradientconst grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");
// Fill outlined text with gradientctx.font = "50px Arial";
ctx.strokeStyle = grad;ctx.strokeText("Hello World",10,80);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = c.getContext("2d");

// Create linear gradient
const grad=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,280,0);
grad.addColorStop(0, "lightblue");
grad.addColorStop(1, "darkblue");

// Fill outlined text with gradient
ctx.font = "50px Arial";
ctx.strokeStyle = grad;
ctx.strokeText("Hello World",10,80);
</script>
